intro: Cleistes uribei, commonly known as the Uribé cleistostoma, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Cleistes uribei is a herbaceous perennial that thrives in moist, shady environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany.
